meanings.definition: Resembling or having the color of alabaster.
meanings.sent1: The alburnous statue gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Her alburnous dress stood out among the vibrant crowd.
meanings.sent3: The alburnous clouds looked like fluffy pillows in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The alburnous moon cast a soft glow over the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The alburnous petals of the flower seemed almost translucent.

meanings.definition: Having a white or pale color.
meanings.sent1: The alburnous walls of the room made it feel spacious.
meanings.sent2: His alburnous skin burned easily in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The alburnous cat blended perfectly with the snowy landscape.
meanings.sent4: The alburnous snow covered the ground like a blanket.
meanings.sent5: The alburnous feathers of the dove were soft to the touch.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a white or pale color.
meanings.sent1: The alburnous paint brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The alburnous light filtered through the window.
meanings.sent3: The alburnous clouds drifted lazily across the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her alburnous hair shone in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The alburnous sand felt cool beneath their feet.
